confession.seduction_context: Found her eating fish on guées de Vigneulles. She had taken fish home; when carrying it met young men dressed like priest who asked her to believe in him and she would never want. Usual seduction scene.

witnesses.name: Annon femme Mengin Regnault le jeune

immediately after Ydatte hugged child's head

harms_alleged.target: his daughter, wife of Didier Cadet

timeline.subject: Ydatte veuve Demenge Moyne
timeline.details: First interrogation. Confessed to witchcraft after being told she would be confronted with Jehenne who denounced her. Described seduction 30 years before, named accomplices at sabbat, admitted to harming Gerard Marchal's son.

timeline.subject: Ydatte veuve Demenge Moyne
timeline.details: Confessed to killing Sibille fille Mengin Regnauld, daughter of Alixy Domballe, and making hail. Admitted several malefices after people refused her alms.

timeline.subject: Ydatte veuve Demenge Moyne
timeline.details: Confessed to killing her niece at Tonnoy, another widow and small son who were begging with her, and pigs at Cuyttefebve. Said she killed large numbers of people around Rozieres but could not remember all due to old age.

timeline.subject: Ydatte veuve Demenge Moyne
timeline.details: Remy asks that summary testimony be taken against her

timeline.subject: Ydatte veuve Demenge Moyne
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to summary testimony

timeline.subject: Ydatte veuve Demenge Moyne
timeline.details: Six witnesses testified against her. She was also confronted with Jehenne Medecin and they confirmed respective confessions. She agreed to all malefices suggested on basis of witness depositions.

timeline.subject: Ydatte veuve Demenge Moyne
timeline.details: Remy asks that she be tortured on grounds she still seems to be concealing some offences

timeline.subject: Ydatte veuve Demenge Moyne
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture and also approves death sentence if she confirms earlier confessions

timeline.subject: Ydatte veuve Demenge Moyne
timeline.details: Executioner (Claude Janney) declined to torture her because she was so feeble and terrified that he thought she might die. She persisted in confessions.

timeline.subject: Ydatte veuve Demenge Moyne
timeline.details: Formal death sentence by court at Rozieres

torture.restrictions: Executioner Claude Janney declined to torture her because she was so feeble and terrified that he thought she might die

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes arose from Ydatte begging for alms. She killed people after they refused her alms or gave her insufficient alms (cheese with no bread to her niece). As a beggar, she was in competition with others and killed another widow 'because woman was more skilled at receiving alms than she was.' She also killed pigs at Cuyttefebve when she was hermit there because they damaged her garden. Commercial disputes included the price of 'curielz' with Alixy Domballe's wife. The accused was clearly impoverished, having been widowed twice and spending final years as a beggar.

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a comprehensive trial record with detailed confessions and witness testimony. Ydatte Moyne was a 68-year-old widow who had been widowed twice and spent her final years as a beggar. Her confessions were extensive and voluntary - torture was approved but not used because the executioner deemed her too feeble. The trial shows a clear pattern of alleged maleficia related to disputes over alms and resources, reflecting the economic vulnerability of an elderly beggar woman. She was denounced by Jehenne (Jehenne Medecin) and confessed immediately, naming 8 accomplices seen at sabbat. The trial moved quickly from arrest to execution (15 days). Notable aspects include: (1) economic context of begging and disputes over alms; (2) confession without torture; (3) marginal note warning not to interrogate Olry Go's wife despite Ydatte naming her; (4) extensive catalog of maleficia spanning years; (5) her statement that she killed so many people she couldn't remember them all due to old age.
